data.title: ScriptEditor -> 'script_close' signal hint correction
data.body:
`ScriptEditor` `script_close` signal had wrong parameter hint, it's type is `Script` not `String` 
Sorry for that

data.title: ARKit
data.body:
This is far from finished and very, very rough, but I figured I'd submit it for people to start taking a look at and coming up with better solutions for a few of the issues.

Functionality everything is there except for plane detection, that shouldn't be hard to add in. For me the main goal was to get the tracking up and running and the camera.

The camera isn't implemented the way I would like to, right now I'm taking the render buffer created by Godot and overlaying it ontop of the camera image during the final copy to screen. I don't believe this is the right way about it. I need to find a way to make the camera image available to the render engine so it can render the geometry on top of the image. The really annoying part here is that the image is provided by the camera as a YCbCr image so it needs to be converted to RGB. Since we get a new image almost every frame I'm doing this in the shader itself.
Basically everything in arkit_shader.h and arkit_shader.cpp should be solved differently

The other thing which right now is fairly dirty is the way everything hangs together. For 90% ARKit actually works with a pull mechanism but the remaining 10% required some ugly hacks. I'll be cleaning that up soon.

Finally there are a bunch of rendering issues but they are issues on iPhone in general. One specific to ARKit is that without a background (it being the camera image of the phone) there is no HDR image to do nice reflections with. I'm uploading a video to YouTube to show off the tracking, will post the link as soon as it finishes.

https://youtu.be/QCH5wOYeIdQ

data.title: PropertyEditor: Fix easing_curve blocking popup input
data.body:
This fixes a bug where easing curve, while drawn behind presets popup, blocks mouse inputs. If popup and the curve overlaps each other, some presets can't be selected.

Fixed by moving it lower in the node tree.

From this image:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26753932/28744177-6f8e1456-7485-11e7-9fc9-88c28f9c54ba.png)
You can't click Linear preset because it overlaps with easing curve.

data.title: Camera doesn't Work/Render when it is child of a Rigidbody
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 Alpha, Windows 10, Wacom Cintiq Companion 2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

When I was attempting to make a 3D racetrack demo using PBR, I parented the camera into a 3D rigidbody node to allow the camera to follow the rigidbody vehicle, but when I started to test out the level by playing the scene, the camera doesn't render the scene correctly or does not show anything at all. I have no idea on how this is happening but unfortunately the camera immediately breaks when parenting in a rigidbody. It also generates errors in the debug area:

`0:00:10:0919 - Condition ' determinant() == 0 ' is true`
`0:00:10:0919 - Condition ' p_axis.is_normalized() ==  false ' is true`
and
`0:00:11:0022 - Condition ' det == 0' is true`

**Steps to reproduce:**

Try parenting by click and dragging the camera node to the rigidbody node to see if the results are the same or not based on what I've encountered so far.

data.title: Fixed AudioStreamPlaybackOGGVorbis::_mix_internal getting stuck in inâ€¦
data.body:
Fixed AudioStreamPlaybackOGGVorbis::_mix_internal getting stuck in in finite loop causing audio to freeze.

More info:
When no audio is playing stb_vorbis_get_samples_float_interleaved returns 0, which means todo is never reduced and the while(todo) loop never exists.

data.title: Example of Good Commenting - Hello Mario Engine
data.body:
I know this isn't really a bug, but I think that this is important for Godot, more specifically its documentation and example projects
https://github.com/HelloFangaming/HelloMarioEngine
This engine written in Game Maker Language is very good at explaining all things written in the object code that aren't immediately obvious from the GameMaker UI (which means such as which parent the object has, which default sprite the object uses, and which mask the object has). For example, the code explains an object's behaviors such as setting the object's creation parameters in the Create event (such as facing direction, which state of the FSM it is in when starting, and which qualities it has such as immune to fireballs, can be stomped, etc.) Speaking of those, it also helped me understand finite state machines in the step events, too (such as how an object changes graphics and movement behavior when it changes to a state, such as throwing, jumping, etc., and how they have variables such as having one sprite when jumping but switch to another when they land). I'm sorry for my fuzzy instructions, because it's been a while since I used that engine due to not wanting to continue development on a project that wasn't GPL-friendly. What I mean to be taken away from this is that I really appreciate when projects do not assume knowledge of the student, and that seeing the same "you do this to x" explanation in each object helped me get the concepts in a general sense.

data.title: Add HarfBuzz for text shaping
data.body:
Change `DynamicFont` to use [HarfBuzz](https://github.com/behdad/harfbuzz) (MIT license) to handle:

1. Context-sensitive shaping and ligatures for complex scripts (Arabic, Devanagari, Thai etc.);
2. Programming ligatures with fonts like [Iosevka](https://github.com/be5invis/Iosevka) & [Fira Code](https://github.com/tonsky/FiraCode) in script editor.

![fonts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7645683/28739597-ddbc6558-7404-11e7-8a73-572f94e62cff.png)


Related: #3081

data.title: Fix get_screen_* funcs returning old values after resolution changes on OS X
data.body: Tested on OS X Yosemite 10.10.1.

data.title: [2.1] Fix mutex initialisation in OS X Audio Driver
data.body:
Mutex was failing to create because the create_func was not being set when the AudioDriverOSX constructor was getting called, on `AudioDriverOSX::init` is working fine now.
I've also cleaned the code a bit and replaced the `int i` to a `int j` so that it doesn't gets confused with the previous `unsigned int i`.

data.title: Attach script file window causes file to be over written.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 alpha
Windows 10
**Issue description:**
Using the attach script file menu creates a new script but does not load a script from disk. This could also lead to users over writing files if unaware.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Right click a node. Select attach script. select the path to the script to attach. Do not hit create else you will over write you file.

data.title: Setting RigidBody into Kinematic mode breaks physic engine
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux, 246b574909f3ae1610001927b773d5b0f2c887e8 

**Issue description:**
Since two days I'm trying to hunt down this bug. Can't track it down but at least I have reproduction reproduction project. 
In my project after setting Hero into KINEMATIC_MODE physic engine goes nuts. Hero position is reseted to the position at which he was loaded, all other bodies are starting to sink through terrain:
![kinematicissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/28727634-db060524-73c5-11e7-812b-e5be5eea0891.gif)


_**video with small additional note:**_ https://youtu.be/rKwi4QlmnM0

I have seen this bug for the first time in in 3.x branch

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download `prev` reproduction project.
2. Run it.
3. Wait

Sorry don't know more direct way to 

**Link to minimal example project:**

data.title: Change display scale when moving the window from monitor to monitor [macOS]
data.body:
Fixes #5688.

Tested with two 1440p external displays (first in scaled 720p HiDPI mode, second in 1440p mode).

Also I am unsure why window resize is necessary (lines 188-190), but it does not work without it (display red background until resized manually).

Update: Resizing to non zero size is better, `windowDidChangeBackingProperties` triggers only once (was triggering on both resizes before).

data.title: Pass GDNativeLibrary pointer to library init
Fix passing Refs via ptrcall
data.body:
There was no constructor for Ref from const pointer, so compiler decided
to construct Variant from pointer and then construct Ref from Variant
which turned it into NULL, because the Variant had null ref field.

data.title: SubViewports do not take inputs
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 3.0.alpha1

**Issue description:**
A subviewport that i made, as a child of a viewport container wont take any inputs at all.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a viewportcontainer, make a viewport as a child of it. try to make inputs happen on any node in the viewport or the viewport itself. _input(event) is not ran. not even set_process_input(true) fixes it.

data.title: Module Question: How to write a module that replaces a core piece of the engine?
data.body:
I am currently working on a project, and due to the nature of the project, and the target I need to write a few modules to replace some core components of the engine.

Specifically the Renderer, and the Physics system.

The documentation states that you can use a module to replace the current renderer, and the physics system. But it is only a hint. There's no information about how to do this correctly.

Can someone point me in the right direction?

data.title: Default project/editor settings box size is way too large on bigger monitors
data.body:
Godot master - e224528
Linux Mint 18.2 Cinnamon x64

Godot automatically calculates the size of the Project/Editor Settings menus based on the main window size, which results in the box being way too big on larger monitors. It makes it really difficult to match up properties with their values, as they're spread too far apart. There should be a hard limit on its size.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27100585/28719359-06a191d6-73ed-11e7-919e-5fafe3b5d35b.png)

data.title: Light2D has performance issues on Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android, Samsung S7 - Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Light2D is very slow and laggy. On the desktop it runs smooth but on Android it slows down unusable. Without shadow and without shader. But as it should be in this state only a texture with add blendmode, it should be have no such impact on the framerate.

**Steps to reproduce:**
[Marble.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1182525/Marble.zip)


I have attached a simple example project. Just tab (or click) the marbles to switch their lights on and off. On Android you will experience a major slowdown. The marbles can be moved with arrow keys (PC) and the accelerometer (Android).

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: correct RMB options for instanced inherited scene
data.body:
When scene is inherited and later instanced as a part of another
scene, only options related to instancing will be visible - same
behavior as in 2.x (also the only way that is correct)
closes #9901

data.title: BUGFIX:  Check for "VCINSTALLDIR" environment variable
data.body: This PR changes a environment variable check that under some circumstances causes compiling to fail on earlier versions of MSVC.  In theory, Godot 3 should compile on any version of Visual Studio or MSVC without issue now.

data.title: Detect newer Visual Studio compilers correctly like VS2017.
data.body: This is just a cherry-picked commit.  Adds proper detection of VS2017 so we're not locked to VS2015.

data.title: Normals artifacting issue on collada exported models
data.body:
First of all, thank you Godot team for your great work. :1st_place_medal: 

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint (Ubuntu) x64

**Issue description:**
For Godot v3.0 alpha custom build 18e23ad

There are some normal artifacts on a Collada exported .dae model, but the normals are fine on an OBJ exported model. I have exported a model from blender using both the default Collada Exporter and the Better Collada Exporter.

I am not sure if this is related to issue #9562. The dae model only artifacts when Normal mapping is enabled.

**Steps to reproduce:**

*3d workflow:*
1.) Exported FBX model from ZBrush
2.) FBX imported into blender, scaled at 100%
3.) UV and materials finalized. Normals checked.

*Godot importation:*
4.) Exported 2 models from Blender directly into Godot Project folder, using the following methods:
--------->a.) Blender's standard Collada .dae plugin
--------->b.) Godot's Better Collada Exporter  

*In the Godot Engine:*
5.) Created a spacial material for the mesh.
6.) Checked [/] Normal Map in the spacial materials parameters

By enabling Normal Map, both models get the exact same Normals artifacting issues in the same areas.

I'm assuming it's the way collada handles normals?


**Link to minimal example project:**
![artifacting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17959437/28701286-08ec13dc-730a-11e7-9d20-42e633b40121.jpg)
![issue2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17959437/28701878-0f66f99e-730e-11e7-988d-03bff6bb7628.png)

[collada_artifacting_issue.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1181951/collada_artifacting_issue.tar.gz) <- A minimal godot project containing the dae exports.

Thanks!
ChrisP
